entities.name: secret
entities.description: A secret is a credential that is used to authenticate an account. These are non-decryptable.

entities.name: temporary_secret
entities.description: A temporary secret needs to be stored for a temporary basis e.g. password reset tokens. We are not using the Secret entity because we don't want that to grow super large.

enums.name: purpose
enums.description: The purpose of the temporary token.

methods.name: authenticate_token
methods.description: Determine if a token is valid/authenticated.

methods.name: login_user
methods.description: Login a user given the credentials, and receive an autenticated token in return.

types.name: authenticate_token_request
types.description: Request object to authenticate a token.

types.name: login_request
types.description: Request object to login a user.

types.name: register_user_request
types.description: Request object to register a new user.

types.name: reset_password_request
types.description: Request object to reset a password.

types.name: send_password_reset_email_request
types.description: Request object to request a password reset.

types.name: validate_password_reset_token_request
types.description: Request object to validate a password reset token.

entities.name: file
entities.description: A file entity is a reference to a file that has been uploaded to the system.

enums.name: storage_client
enums.description: The storage client that the file is stored in.

entities.name: secret_decryptable
entities.description: A secret that we can decrypt and recover. The values are encrypted and stored in the database.

entities.name: secret_key
entities.description: A secret key entity is a reference to a secret key that can be used to encrypt/decrypt secrets.

methods.name: file_upload
methods.description: Upload a new file to the system. The file will be stored in the specified storage client. The uploaded file ID can then be used to reference the file in other entities.

entities.name: access_token
entities.description: An access token represents a token that can be used to access the system.

fields.name: one_time_available_value
fields.description: The value of the token, displayed only once when the token is created.

entities.name: account
entities.description: An account represents a user or a machine that can access the system.

entities.name: device
entities.description: A device associated with a user.

enums.name: operating_system
enums.description: The operating system of the device.

entities.name: entity_permission
entities.description: A permission is a group of actions that can be performed.

entities.name: role
entities.description: A role represents a set of permissions.

entities.name: user
entities.description: A user represents a human that can access the system.

methods.name: who_am_i
methods.description: Determine who the authenticated user is.

enums.name: entity_data_scope
enums.description: Given multiple instances of an entity, what instances does the permission apply to.

types.name: address
types.description: An object representing a phsyical address.

types.name: contact
types.description: An object representing a person's contact information.

types.name: message_response
types.description: A response type that contains a message.

types.name: person_name
types.description: An object representing a person's name.

types.name: phone_number
types.description: An object representing a phone number.

enums.name: country
enums.description: All the countries in the world.

enums.name: country_telephone_code
enums.description: All the telephone country countries in the world.

enums.name: gender
enums.description: All the possible gender values that can be used in the system.

enums.name: timezone
enums.description: All the possible timezones that can be used in the system.

enums.name: usa_state
enums.description: All the states in the US, including territories.
